name: jalapeno jerk jerk
description:
Step right up ladies and gentlemen! What you are about to experience will make your taste buds stand-up and cheer! I’ve traveled the country with this sideshow developing halo’s Jalapeño Jerk Jerk; a blend of traditional jerk spices with a jalapeño flair. Tastes great on chicken, pork, eggs, corn, or even in a Bloody Mary. Always remember to put halo’s on it. 

It’s a dry rubbin’ seasoning spice, so shake first. Well, unless you can juggle.

name: low noon BBQ
description:
I may be the smallest cowboy but I have the world’s largest appetite! I’ve roped in some of the finest carnivoreriffic treats and even some of the best herbivoreriffic beasts! My BBQ seasoning is a blend of sweet with a subtle touch of heat; sugars corral your tongue while the chili and cayenne dig their spurs in.  Rub a rack of ribs, toss in chili, season pork tenderloin or sprinkle on corn, popped or not. Always remember to put halo’s on it.

It’s a dry rubbin’ seasoning spice, so shake first. Well, unless you can juggle.

name: engine No. 9
description:
I’m the world’s strongest man.  I lift swine with one hand, pull pineapple plants out with two, fire trucks should take three but I’m the bees knees. My engine no. 9 spice can be used on almost anything. It’s a seraphic flavor blend of 9 spices, where sweet and heat become incestuous. So, pound a pork tenderloin, squat a soup or salad, let it lift your winning chili or even curl your favorite corn. Always remember to put halo’s on it.

It’s a dry rubbin’ seasoning spice, so shake first. Well, unless you can juggle.
